attributes.action: remove tax on vegetable oil used as motor vehicle fuel
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With minor modifications, diesel engines can be run on vegetable oil such as rape seed oil. However, the government levies a tax of 48.35 pence on a litre of vegetable oil used as a fuel for motor vehicles, making it an uncompetitive alternative to diesel fuel. 

This petition requests the removal of this tax to increase the use of vegetable oil to power motor vehicles, thereby:

Reducing carbon emissions
Reducing expensive oil imports
Helping local farmers
